workflow.name: Workshop: Enrich Intrusion and Block Domain
workflow.title: Workshop: Enrich Intrusion and Block Domain

properties.name: AMP_Cloud
properties.description:
Where is the AMP organization located, options are:

eu for Europe
nam for americas
apjc for Asia Pacific

properties.name: Threat Response Token Time
properties.description: The time at which the Threat Response access token was last fetched. This is used to determine when it's time to fetch a new token and should not be modified

properties.name: Threat Response Access Token
properties.description: Placeholder for the Threat Response access token. This token will be fetched as needed throughout the workflow and this variable should not be modified

This workflow fetchs Cisco Secure Firewall incidents and conducts automated enrichment to see if additional data can be found about the event. The public IPv4 or domain name is searched in Umbrella database, if the IP or domain is malicious is added to an Umbrella destination list. The source of the event is searched in Cisco Secure Endpoint and if a matching endpoint is found, an Orbital live query is performed and a forensic analysis is created. A casebook and sighting are created and a message is sent to a configured Cisco Webex teams space

More Information: https://github.com/jponcedo/SecureX_June2022_Webinar
properties.display_name: Workshop: Enrich Intrusion and Block Domain

actions.name: Execute Python Script
actions.title: Build the casebook description, targets, and observables

properties.display_name: Build the casebook description, targets, and observables

properties.script:
import sys,json

ampComputer = sys.argv[1]
ampComputer = json.loads(ampComputer)

datetime = sys.argv[2]

computerLink = ampComputer['links']['computer']
computerLink = computerLink.replace('api.', 'console.').replace('/v1', '')

cloud = sys.argv[3]
visibility_url = "https://visibility.amp.cisco.com/investigate?spid="
casebookurl = "https://private.intel.amp.cisco.com:443/ctia/casebook/"
if cloud == 'eu':
  visibility_url = "https://visibility.eu.amp.cisco.com/investigate?spid="
  casebookurl = "https://private.intel.eu.amp.cisco.com:443/ctia/casebook/"
if cloud == 'apjc':
  visibility_url = "https://visibility.apjc.amp.cisco.com/investigate?spid="
  casebookurl = "https://private.intel.apjc.amp.cisco.com:443/ctia/casebook/"

casebookId = sys.argv[4].replace(casebookurl,"")
orbitalResultURL = sys.argv[5]

casebookDescription = "## Workshop: Enrich Intrusion and Block Domain \n"
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + '+ Found a Firewall Intrusion Event: {} -> {} \n'.format(sys.argv[6],sys.argv[7])
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + '+ Connected with Secure Endpoint user [' + ampComputer['hostname'] + '](' + computerLink + ") \n"
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + '+ Operating System: ' + ampComputer['operating_system'] + "\n"
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + '+ Isolation Available: ' + ('Yes' if ampComputer['isolation']['available'] else 'No') + "\n + Endpoint Isolated: " + ('Yes' if ampComputer['isolation']['status'] == 'isolated' else 'No')
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + "\n\n***Call to Action:***\n"
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + "+ Action Item 1 - Download Forensic analysis: {}\n".format(orbitalResultURL)
casebookDescription = casebookDescription + "+ Action Item 2 - Investigate in Threat Response: {}{}\n".format(visibility_url,casebookId)

observables = []
observables.append({ 'type': 'hostname', 'value': ampComputer['hostname'] })
observables.append({ 'type': 'amp_computer_guid', 'value': ampComputer['connector_guid'] })

for ip in ampComputer['internal_ips']:
	observables.append({ 'type': 'ip', 'value': ip })

if len(json.loads(sys.argv[8])) > 0:
  for element in json.loads(sys.argv[8]):
    observables.append(element)
if len(json.loads(sys.argv[9])) > 0:
  for element in json.loads(sys.argv[9]):
    observables.append(element)

for adapter in ampComputer['network_addresses']:
	if 'mac' in adapter:
		observables.append({ 'type': 'mac_address', 'value': adapter['mac'] })
	if 'ip' in adapter and not { 'type': 'ip', 'value': adapter['ip'] } in observables:
		observables.append({ 'type': 'ip', 'value': adapter['ip'] })

target = {
	'type': 'endpoint',
	'observables': observables,
	'observed_time': {
		'start_time': datetime
	}
}

observables = json.dumps(observables)
target = json.dumps([ target ])

properties.name: Destination List Name
properties.description: The name of the destination list you want records added to

This workflow adds an observable to the configured destination list in Cisco Umbrella. Supported observables: ip, domain

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Target: Umbrella Management

Steps:
[] Make sure the observable type provided is supported
[] Get all of the organization's destination lists
[] Extract the ID of the configured destination list
[] Check if extracting the destination list ID was successful:
[]> If it was, add the record to the list
[]> If it wasn't, output an error

More information: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0017
